body:
Successfully builds and passes all unit tests on macOS 10.15.6 with Apple Clang 11.0.3.

```yaml
  bash:
    externals:
    - spec: bash@5.0.16
      prefix: /Users/Adam/.spack/darwin/.spack-env/view
    - spec: bash@3.2.57
      prefix: /
```
Bash is weird in the sense that they don't release a tarball for 5.0.18, they release a tarball for 5.0 and 18 consecutive patches to apply. I'm not sure if there's an easy way to sync Spack's version representation and our external package version detection.
title: Bash: add v5.0.18, external package detection
